page.title: 10CHIRNSIDE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school opened in October 1940 for pupils from 5 to 14 years. From August 1968 this has been a primary school. All pupils now receive their secondary education at The Berwickshire High School, Duns. Besides the primary department with 143 pupils and 6 class teachers _ the Headteacher does not take a class _ there is a Nursery and a Special Unit which opened in August 1979 and May 1983 respectively. There are 20 children aged 3 to 5 years in the Nursery in the morning and 20 in the afternoon, and 6 severely mentally handicapped children in the Special Unit. There are a nursery teacher and nursery nurse and, in the Unit, a teacher and an instructress. There are visiting teachers of art, remedial education, music and PE. Older pupils have swimming in Duns.
